DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Primary Anatomic Site Subtype 2 Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body that are a secondary subtype of the primary biospecimen source.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Named locations of, or within, the body._A group forming a type within a larger type._The words or language units by which a thing is known._Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
Named locations of or within the body.

Property.preferredDefinition: A group forming a type within a larger type.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A group forming a type within a larger type.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by S.Lalkota. mc 8/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredName: Biospecimen Primary Anatomic Site Subtype 2 Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fourth portion of the large intestine (colon) that communicates with the transverse colon in the left-upper quadrant of the abdomen and the rectum below.

Concepts.definition: The fourth portion of the large intestine (colon) that communicates with the transverse colon in the left-upper quadrant of the abdomen and the rectum below.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The muscular organ located in the floor of the mouth and serving as the principal organ of taste and modification of the voice in speech.

Concepts.definition: The muscular organ located in the floor of the mouth and serving as the principal organ of taste and modification of the voice in speech.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The external female genital organs, including the clitoris, vaginal lips, and the opening to the vagina.

Concepts.definition: The external, visible part of the female genitalia surrounding the urethral and vaginal opening. The vulva includes the clitoris and inner as well as outer labia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.

Concepts.definition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lower part of the pharynx that connects to the esophagus.

Concepts.definition: The lower part of the pharynx that connects to the esophagus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped retroperitoneal organ situated below the diaphragm and posterior to the spleen.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped retroperitoneal organ situated below the diaphragm and posterior to the spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

Concepts.definition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The third division of the colon (large intestine). It communicates with the ascending colon in the upper right-hand quadrant of the abdomen and the descending colon in the upper left-hand quadrant.

Concepts.definition: The third division of the colon (large intestine). It communicates with the ascending colon in the upper right-hand quadrant of the abdomen and the descending colon in the upper left-hand quadrant.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bony anterior part of the roof of the mouth separating the nose from the mouth.

Concepts.definition: The bony anterior part of the roof of the mouth separating the nose from the mouth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

DataElement.changeDescription: VM concept annotation complete and CDEs released. mc 10/7/16 Moved from CTD-2 to OCG Context per request by S.Jagu. mc 2/1/17
